In this book, Sam is an antiquarian book dealer in Victorian London, who finds himself entangled in a series of murders. To aid in his investigation and protect himself, he assumes the identity of a man whose details he has acquired through a stolen diary.

First, Sam selects the identity of a man named Edmund Burroughes, who shares some physical characteristics and age. He gathers information about Edmund's life and creates a persona that will be convincing to others. To make the identity more authentic, he obtains some of Edmund's personal belongings, such as clothes and documents.

Next, Sam changes his appearance, cutting his hair and changing his style, and goes through the meticulous process of forging identification documents such as a driver's license and bank accounts. He even hires an artist to create a convincing passport photo.

Once he has established the new identity, Sam begins to integrate himself into Edmund's life, meeting his friends and acquaintances and reconnecting with his ex-wife. He uses the information he has gathered about Edmund and his relationships to further bolster his disguise and gain access to new leads in the case that he is investigating.

This novel skillfully combines elements of mystery, historical fiction, and thriller, as Sam navigates the dangerous streets of London while unraveling the secrets of the past.
